items.name: VariableStore
items.content:
# =================================================================== # # Script: VariableStore # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class VariableStore @objectCodecBlackList = ["persistentNumbers", "persistentStrings", "persistentBooleans", "persistentLists"] ###* *

A storage for different kind of game variables. The following scopes * for variables exist:

* * - Local Variables -> Only valid for the current scene. * - Global Variables -> Valid for the whole game but bound to a single save-game. * - Persistent Variables -> Valid for the whole game indepentent from the save-games. * *

The following data-types exist:

* - Strings -> Variables storing text data. * - Numbers -> Variables storing integer number values. * - Booleans -> Variables storing boolean values. (Called "Switches" for easier understanding) * - Lists -> Variables storing multiple other variables. Lists can also contain Lists. *

* Local variables are stored by scene UID. For each scene UID a list of local variables is stored.

* *

Global and persistent variables are stored and a specific domain. A domain is just a unique name such * as com.example.game for example. The default domain is an empty string. Domains are useful to avoid * overlapping of variable numbers when sharing content with other users.

* * @module gs * @class VariableStore * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: () -> ###* * Current local variable context * @property context * @type Object ### @context = null ###* * Current domain for global and persistent variables. Each domain has its own * variables. Please use changeDomain method to change the domain. * @property domain * @type Object * @readOnly ### @domain = "" ###* * List of available domains for global and persistent variables. * @property domains * @type string[] ### @domains = [""] ###* * The global number variables of the current domain. * @property numbers * @type number[] ### @numbers = null ###* * The global boolean variables of the current domain. * @property booleans * @type boolean[] ### @booleans = null ###* * The global string variables of the current domain. * @property strings * @type string[] ### @strings = null ###* * The global list variables of the current domain. * @property lists * @type Object[][] ### @lists = null ###* * The storage of all global variables by domain. * @property globalVariablesByDomain * @type Object[][] ### @globalVariablesByDomain = {} ###* * The storage of all persistent variables by domain. * @property persistentVariablesByDomain * @type Object[][] ### @persistentVariablesByDomain = {} ###* * The persistent number variables of the current domain. * @property persistentNumbers * @type number[] ### @persistentNumbers = [] ###* * The persistent string variables of the current domain. * @property persistentStrings * @type string[] ### @persistentStrings = [] ###* * The persistent boolean variables of the current domain. * @property persistentBooleans * @type boolean[] ### @persistentBooleans = [] ###* * The persistent list variables of the current domain. * @property persistentLists * @type Object[][] ### @persistentLists = [] ###* * The local number variables. * @property localNumbers * @type Object ### @localNumbers = {} ###* * The local string variables. * @property localStrings * @type Object ### @localStrings = {} ###* * The local boolean variables. * @property localBooleans * @type Object ### @localBooleans = {} ###* * The local list variables. * @property localLists * @type Object ### @localLists = {} ###* * @property tempNumbers * @type number[] ### @tempNumbers = null ###* * @property tempStrings * @type string[] ### @tempStrings = null ###* * @property localBooleans * @type number[] ### @tempBooleans = null ###* * @property localLists * @type Object[][] ### @tempLists = null ###* * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc. * * @method onDataBundleRestore. * @param Object data - The data-bundle * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context. ### onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) -> domains = DataManager.getDocumentsByType("global_variables").select (d) -> d.items.domain for domain, i in domains @numbersByDomain[domain] = @numbersByDomain[i] @stringsByDomain[domain] = @stringsByDomain[i] @booleansByDomain[domain] = @booleansByDomain[i] @listsByDomain[domain] = @listsByDomain[i] return null setupGlobalDomains: () -> @numbersByDomain = [] @stringsByDomain = [] @booleansByDomain = [] @listsByDomain = [] for domain, i in @domains @numbersByDomain[i] = new Array(1000) @numbersByDomain[domain] = @numbersByDomain[i] @stringsByDomain[i] = new Array(1000) @stringsByDomain[domain] = @stringsByDomain[i] @booleansByDomain[i] = new Array(1000) @booleansByDomain[domain] = @booleansByDomain[i] @listsByDomain[i] = new Array(1000) @listsByDomain[domain] = @listsByDomain[i] @numbers = @numbersByDomain[0] @strings = @stringsByDomain[0] @booleans = @booleansByDomain[0] @lists = @listsByDomain[0] setupPersistentDomains: (domains) -> @persistentNumbersByDomain = {} @persistentStringsByDomain = {} @persistentBooleansByDomain = {} @persistentListsByDomain = {} for domain, i in @domains @persistentNumbersByDomain[i] = new Array(10) @persistentNumbersByDomain[domain] = @persistentNumbers[i] @persistentStringsByDomain[i] = new Array(10) @persistentStringsByDomain[domain] = @persistentStrings[i] @persistentBooleansByDomain[i] = new Array(10) @persistentBooleansByDomain[domain] = @persistentBooleans[i] @persistentListsByDomain[i] = new Array(10) @persistentListsByDomain[domain] = @persistentLists[i] @persistentNumbers = @persistentNumbersByDomain[0] @persistentStrings = @persistentStringsByDomain[0] @persistentBooleans = @persistentBooleansByDomain[0] @persistentLists = @persistentListsByDomain[0] setupDomains: (domains) -> @domains = domains @setupGlobalDomains() @setupPersistentDomains() ###* * Restores the variable store from a serialized store. ### restore: (store) -> ignore = ["domains"] for k of store if !k.startsWith("persistent") and ignore.indexOf(k) == -1 this[k] = store[k]; ###* * Changes the current domain. * * @deprecated * @method changeDomain * @param {string} domain - The domain to change to. ### changeDomain: (domain) -> @domain = domain globalVariables = @globalVariablesByDomain[domain] persistentVariables = @persistentVariablesByDomain[domain] if !globalVariables globalVariables = @globalVariablesByDomain[domain] = { numbers: new Array(500), strings: new Array(500), booleans: new Array(500), lists: new Array(500) } if !persistentVariables persistentVariables = @persistentVariablesByDomain[domain] = { numbers: new Array(500), strings: new Array(500), booleans: new Array(500), lists: new Array(500) } @numbers = globalVariables.numbers @strings = globalVariables.strings @booleans = globalVariables.booleans @lists = globalVariables.lists @persistentNumbers = persistentVariables.numbers @persistentBooleans = persistentVariables.booleans @persistentStrings = persistentVariables.strings @persistentLists = persistentVariables.lists ###* * Clears all global variables * * @method clearGlobalVariables ### clearAllGlobalVariables: -> @setupGlobalDomains() return globalVariables = @globalVariablesByDomain[@domain] @numbersByDomain = new Array(1000) globalVariables.booleans = new Array(1000) globalVariables.strings = new Array(1000) @numbers = globalVariables.numbers @strings = globalVariables.strings @booleans = globalVariables.booleans ###* * Clears all local variables for all contexts/scenes/common-events. * * @method clearAllLocalVariables ### clearAllLocalVariables: -> @localNumbers = {} @localStrings = {} @localBooleans = {} @localLists = {} ###* * Clears specified variables. * * @method clearVariables * @param {number[]} numbers - The number variables to clear. * @param {string[]} strings - The string variables to clear. * @param {boolean[]} booleans - The boolean variables to clear. * @param {Array[]} lists - The list variables to clear. * @param {number} type - Determines what kind of variables should be cleared. *
    *
  • 0 = All
    • *
  • 1 = Switches / Booleans
    • *
  • 2 = Numbers
    • *
  • 3 = Texts
    • *
  • 4 = Lists
    • *
* @param {Object} range - The variable id-range to clear. If null all specified variables are cleared. ### clearVariables: (numbers, strings, booleans, lists, type, range) -> switch type when 0 # All numbers?.fill(0, range.start, range.end) strings?.fill("", range.start, range.end) booleans?.fill(false, range.start, range.end) lists?.fill([], range.start, range.end) when 1 # Switch booleans?.fill(false, range.start, range.end) when 2 # Number numbers?.fill(0, range.start, range.end) when 3 # Text strings?.fill("", range.start, range.end) when 4 # List lists?.fill([], range.start, range.end) ###* * Clears all local variables for a specified context. If the context is not specified, all * local variables for all contexts/scenes/common-events are cleared. * * @method clearLocalVariables * @param {Object} context - The context to clear the local variables for. If null, all * @param {number} type - Determines what kind of variables should be cleared. *
    *
  • 0 = All
    • *
  • 1 = Switches / Booleans
    • *
  • 2 = Numbers
    • *
  • 3 = Texts
    • *
  • 4 = Lists
    • *
* @param {Object} range - The variable id-range to clear. If null all variables are cleared. ### clearLocalVariables: (context, type, range) -> if context? ids = [context.id] else ids = Object.keys(@localNumbers) if range? range = start: range.start, end: range.end + 1 else range = start: 0, end: null for id in ids @clearVariables(@localNumbers[id], @localStrings[id], @localBooleans[id], @localLists[id], type, range) ###* * Clears global variables. * * @method clearGlobalVariables * @param {number} type - Determines what kind of variables should be cleared. *
    *
  • 0 = All
    • *
  • 1 = Switches / Booleans
    • *
  • 2 = Numbers
    • *
  • 3 = Texts
    • *
  • 4 = Lists
    • *
* @param {Object} range - The variable id-range to clear. If null all variables are cleared. ### clearGlobalVariables: (type, range) -> if range? range = start: range.start, end: range.end + 1 else range = start: 0, end: null @clearVariables(@numbers, @strings, @booleans, @lists, type, range) ###* * Clears persistent variables. * * @method clearPersistentVariables * @param {number} type - Determines what kind of variables should be cleared. *
    *
  • 0 = All
    • *
  • 1 = Switches / Booleans
    • *
  • 2 = Numbers
    • *
  • 3 = Texts
    • *
  • 4 = Lists
    • *
* @param {Object} range - The variable id-range to clear. If null all variables are cleared. ### clearPersistentVariables: (type, range) -> if range? range = start: range.start, end: range.end + 1 else range = start: 0, end: null @clearVariables(@persistentNumbers, @persistentstrings, @persistentBooleans, @persistentLists, type, range) ###* * Initializes the variables. Should be called whenever the context changes. (Like after a scene change) * * @method setup * @param {Object} context - The context(current scene) needed for local variables. Needs have at least an id-property. ### setup: (context) -> @setupLocalVariables(context) @setupTempVariables(context) ###* * Initializes the local variables for the specified context. Should be called on first time use. * * @method setupLocalVariables * @param {Object} context - The context(current scene). Needs have at least an id-property. ### setupLocalVariables: (context) -> @setupVariables(context, "localNumbers", 0) @setupVariables(context, "localStrings", "") @setupVariables(context, "localBooleans", no) @setupVariables(context, "localLists", []) ###* * Initializes the specified kind of variables. * * @method setupVariables * @param {Object} context - The context(current scene). Needs have at least an id-property. * @param {string} property - The kind of variables (property-name). * @param {Object} defaultValue - The default value for each variable. ### setupVariables: (context, property, defaultValue) -> if not this[property][context.id]? this[property][context.id] = [] ###* * Initializes the current temp variables for the specified context. Should be called whenever the context changed. * * @method setupTempVariables * @param {Object} context - The context(current scene). Needs have at least an id-property. ### setupTempVariables: (context) -> @context = context if !@localNumbers[context.id] @setupLocalVariables(context) @tempNumbers = @localNumbers[context.id] @tempStrings = @localStrings[context.id] @tempBooleans = @localBooleans[context.id] @tempLists = @localLists[context.id] clearTempVariables: (context) -> @context = context if !@localNumbers[context.id] @setupLocalVariables(context) @localNumbers[context.id] = [] @localStrings[context.id] = [] @localBooleans[context.id] = [] @localLists[context.id] = [] ###* * Gets the index for the variable with the specified name. If a variable with that * name cannot be found, the index will be 0. * * @method indexOfTempVariable * @param {string} name - The name of the variable to get the index for. * @param {string} type - The type name: number, string, boolean or list. * @param {number} scope - The variable scope: 0 = local, 1 = global, 2 = persistent. * @param {string} domain - The variable domain to search in. If not specified, the default domain will be used. ### indexOfVariable: (name, type, scope, domain) -> result = 0 switch scope when 0 # Local result = @indexOfTempVariable(name, type) when 1 # Global result = @indexOfGlobalVariable(name, type, domain) when 2 # Persistent result = @indexOfPersistentVariable(name, type, domain) return result ###* * Gets the index for the local variable with the specified name. If a variable with that * name cannot be found, the index will be 0. * * @method indexOfTempVariable * @param {string} name - The name of the variable to get the index for. * @param {string} type - The type name: number, string, boolean or list. ### indexOfTempVariable: (name, type) -> result = 0 if @context?.owner if @context.owner.sceneDocument variable = @context.owner.sceneDocument.items[type + "Variables"].first (v) -> v.name == name result = variable.index if variable? else if @context.owner[type + "Variables"] variable = @context.owner[type + "Variables"].first (v) -> v.name == name if variable? result = variable.index else console.warn("Variable referenced by name not found: " + name +"(local, "+type+")") return result ###* * Gets the index for the global variable with the specified name. If a variable with that * name cannot be found, the index will be 0. * * @method indexOfTempVariable * @param {string} name - The name of the variable to get the index for. * @param {string} type - The type name: number, string, boolean or list. * @param {string} domain - The variable domain to search in. If not specified, the default domain will be used. ### indexOfGlobalVariable: (name, type, domain) -> result = 0 variables = DataManager.getDocumentsByType("global_variables") variablesDocument = variables.first (v) -> v.items.domain == domain variablesDocument ?= variables[0] if variablesDocument variable = variablesDocument.items[type + "s"].first (v) -> v.name == name if variable result = variable.index else console.warn("Variable referenced by name not found: #{name} (persistent, #{type})") return result ###* * Gets the index for the persistent variable with the specified name. If a variable with that * name cannot be found, the index will be 0. * * @method indexOfTempVariable * @param {string} name - The name of the variable to get the index for. * @param {string} type - The type name: number, string, boolean or list. * @param {string} domain - The variable domain to search in. If not specified, the default domain will be used. ### indexOfPersistentVariable: (name, type, domain) -> result = 0 variables = DataManager.getDocumentsByType("persistent_variables") variablesDocument = variables.first (v) -> v.items.domain == domain variablesDocument ?= variables[0] if variablesDocument variable = variablesDocument.items[type + "s"].first (v) -> v.name == name if variable? result = variable.index else console.warn("Variable referenced by name not found: #{name} (persistent, #{type})") return result ###* * Sets the value of the number variable at the specified index. * * @method setNumberValueAtIndex * @param {number} scope - The variable scope. * @param {number} type - The variable's index. * @param {number} value - The value to set. ### setNumberValueAtIndex: (scope, index, value, domain) -> if scope == 2 @persistentNumbersByDomain[domain][index] = value else if scope == 1 @numbersByDomain[domain||0][index] = value else @tempNumbers[index] = value ###* * Sets the value of a specified number variable. * * @method setNumberValueAtIndex * @param {number} variable - The variable to set. * @param {number} value - The value to set. ### setNumberValueTo: (variable, value) -> if variable.scope == 2 @persistentNumbersByDomain[variable.domain||0][variable.index] = value else if variable.scope == 1 @numbersByDomain[variable.domain||0][variable.index] = value else @tempNumbers[variable.index] = value ###* * Sets the value of a specified list variable. * * @method setListObjectTo * @param {Object} variable - The variable to set. * @param {Object} value - The value to set. ### setListObjectTo: (variable, value) -> if variable.scope == 2 @persistentListsByDomain[variable.domain||0][variable.index] = value else if variable.scope == 1 @listsByDomain[variable.domain||0][variable.index] = value else @tempLists[variable.index] = value ###* * Sets the value of a specified boolean variable. * * @method setBooleanValueTo * @param {Object} variable - The variable to set. * @param {boolean} value - The value to set. ### setBooleanValueTo: (variable, value) -> if variable.scope == 2 @persistentBooleansByDomain[variable.domain][variable.index] = value else if variable.scope == 1 @booleansByDomain[variable.domain][variable.index] = value else @tempBooleans[variable.index] = value ###* * Sets the value of the boolean variable at the specified index. * * @method setBooleanValueAtIndex * @param {number} scope - The variable scope. * @param {number} index - The variable's index. * @param {boolean} value - The value to set. ### setBooleanValueAtIndex: (scope, index, value, domain) -> if scope == 2 @persistentBooleansByDomain[domain][index] = value else if scope == 1 @booleansByDomain[domain][index] = value else @tempBooleans[index] = value ###* * Sets the value of a specified string variable. * * @method setStringValueTo * @param {Object} variable - The variable to set. * @param {string} value - The value to set. ### setStringValueTo: (variable, value) -> if variable.scope == 2 @persistentStringsByDomain[variable.domain][variable.index] = value else if variable.scope == 1 @stringsByDomain[variable.domain][variable.index] = value else @tempStrings[variable.index] = value ###* * Sets the value of the string variable at the specified index. * * @method setStringValueAtIndex * @param {number} scope - The variable scope. * @param {number} index - The variable's index. * @param {string} value - The value to set. ### setStringValueAtIndex: (scope, index, value, domain) -> if scope == 2 @persistentStringsByDomain[domain][index] = value else if scope == 1 @stringsByDomain[domain][index] = value else @tempStrings[index] = value ###* * Gets the value of a specified list variable. * * @method listObjectOf * @param {Object} object - The list-variable/object to get the value from. * @return {Object} The list-object. ### listObjectOf: (object) -> result = 0 if object? and object.index? if object.scope == 2 result = @persistentListsByDomain[object.domain][object.index] else if object.scope == 1 result = @listsByDomain[object.domain][object.index] else result = @tempLists[object.index] else result = object return result || [] ###* * Gets the value of a number variable at the specified index. * * @method numberValueAtIndex * @param {number} scope - The variable scope. * @param {number} index - The variable's index. * @return {Object} The number value of the variable. ### numberValueAtIndex: (scope, index, domain) -> result = 0 if scope == 2 result = @persistentNumbersByDomain[domain][index] else if scope == 1 result = @numbersByDomain[domain][index] else result = @tempNumbers[index] return result || 0 ###* * Gets the value of a specified number variable. * * @method numberValueOf * @param {Object} object - The variable to get the value from. * @return {Object} The number value of the variable. ### numberValueOf: (object) -> result = 0 if object? and object.index? if object.scope == 2 result = @persistentNumbersByDomain[object.domain][object.index] else if object.scope == 1 result = @numbersByDomain[object.domain][object.index] else result = @tempNumbers[object.index] else result = object return result || 0 ###* * Gets the value of a specified string variable. * * @method stringValueOf * @param {Object} object - The variable to get the value from. * @return {string} The string value of the variable. ### stringValueOf: (object) -> result = "" if object? and object.index? if object.scope == 2 result = @persistentStringsByDomain[object.domain][object.index] else if object.scope == 1 result = @stringsByDomain[object.domain][object.index] else result = @tempStrings[object.index] else result = object return result || "" ###* * Gets the value of a string variable at the specified index. * * @method stringValueAtIndex * @param {number} scope - The variable scope. * @param {number} index - The variable's index. * @return {string} The string value of the variable. ### stringValueAtIndex: (scope, index, domain) -> result = "" if scope == 2 result = @persistentStringsByDomain[domain][index] else if scope == 1 result = @stringsByDomain[domain][index] else result = @tempStrings[index] return result || "" ###* * Gets the value of a specified boolean variable. * * @method booleanValueOf * @param {Object} object - The variable to get the value from. * @return {Object} The boolean value of the variable. ### booleanValueOf: (object) -> result = no if object? and object.index? if object.scope == 2 result = @persistentBooleansByDomain[object.domain][object.index] || no else if object.scope == 1 result = @booleansByDomain[object.domain][object.index] || no else result = @tempBooleans[object.index] || no else result = if object then true else false return result ###* * Gets the value of a boolean variable at the specified index. * * @method booleanValueAtIndex * @param {number} scope - The variable scope. * @param {number} index - The variable's index. * @return {boolean} The boolean value of the variable. ### booleanValueAtIndex: (scope, index, domain) -> result = no if scope == 2 result = @persistenBooleansByDomain[domain][index] || no else if scope == 1 result = @booleansByDomain[domain][index] || no else result = @tempBooleans[index] || no return result gs.VariableStore = VariableStore
